list.text: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life.
list.author: Richard Bach

list.text: The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence.
list.author: Denis Waitley

list.text: There is no doubt that it is around the family and the home that all the greatest virtues… are created, strengthened and maintained.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: The family is a school of compassion because it is here that we learn to live with other people.
list.author: Karen Armstrong

list.text: A family is a place where minds come in contact with one another.
list.author: Buddha

list.text: Families are the compass that guides us. They are the inspiration to reach great heights, and our comfort when we occasionally falter.
list.author: Brad Henry

list.text: A man should never neglect his family for business.
list.author: Walt Disney

list.text: Family is the first word in the language of life.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Family: Where life begins and love never ends.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches.
list.author: Wanda Hope Carter

list.text: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.
list.author: George Santayana

list.text: Rejoice with your family in the beautiful land of life.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.text: Family is not an important thing, it's everything.
list.author: Michael J. Fox

list.text: Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family.
list.author: Anthony Brandt

list.text: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
list.author: George Bernard Shaw

list.text: Family is the most important thing in the world.
list.author: Princess Diana

list.text: The informality of family life is a blessed condition that allows us to become our best while looking our worst.
list.author: Marge Kennedy

list.text: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
list.author: Charles Kuralt

list.text: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.
list.author: Richard Bach

list.text: When trouble comes, it's your family that supports you.
list.author: Guy Lafleur

list.text: In family life, love is the oil that eases friction, the cement that binds closer together, and the music that brings harmony.
list.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

list.text: A man should never neglect his family for business.
list.author: Walt Disney

list.text: Our family is a circle of strength of love with every birth and every union the circle grows.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Family is the anchor that holds us through life's storms.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: The best thing about having a family is that you know that they will always love you and support you no matter what.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: The memories we make with our family is everything.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: A family is a gift that lasts forever.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Families are like branches on a tree, we grow in different directions yet our roots remain as one.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works is the family.
list.author: Lee Iacocca

list.text: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family: Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
list.author: Jane Howard

list.text: I sustain myself with the love of family.
list.author: Maya Angelou

list.text: No matter what you've done for yourself or for humanity, if you can't look back on having given love and attention to your own family, what have you really accomplished?
list.author: Lee Iacocca

list.text: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them.
list.author: Desmond Tutu

list.text: The greatest gift of family life is to be intimately acquainted with people you might never even introduce yourself to, had life not done it for you.
list.author: Kendall Hailey

list.text: Family and friendships are two of the greatest facilitators of happiness.
list.author: John C. Maxwell

list.text: A family can develop only with a loving woman as its center.
list.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

list.text: In every conceivable manner, the family is link to our past, bridge to our future.
list.author: Alex Haley

list.text: The family is a haven in a heartless world.
list.author: Christopher Lasch

list.text: When all the dust is settled and all the crowds are gone, the things that matter are faith, family, and friends.
list.author: Barbara Bush

list.text: Being a family means you are part of something very wonderful. It means you will love and be loved for the rest of your life.
list.author: Lisa Weedn

list.text: Food is not just eating energy. It's an experience.

list.text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.

list.text: The hardest thing about missing someone is not being able to tell them how much they mean to you.

list.text: “In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
list.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

list.text: “You’ve got to stop doing all the things that people have tried, tested, and found out don’t work.
list.author: Michael Dunlop

list.text: “I never perfected an invention that I did not think about in terms of the service it might give others… I find out what the world needs, then I proceed to invent.
list.author: Thomas Edison

list.text: “If you’re not making mistakes, then you’re not making decisions.
list.author: Catherine Cook

list.text: “Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
list.author: Bill Gates

list.text: “One can get anything if he is willing to help enough others get what they want.
list.author: Zig Ziglar

list.text: “An entrepreneur tends to bite off a little more than he can chew hoping he’ll quickly learn how to chew it.
list.author: Roy Ash

list.text: “The true entrepreneur is a doer, not a dreamer.
list.author: Nolan Bushnell

list.text: “Whenever you are asked if you can do a job, tell ’em, ‘Certainly, I can!’ Then get busy and find out how to do it.
list.author: Theodore Roosevelt

list.text: “Everything started as nothing.
list.author: Ben Weissenstein

list.text: “If you start with nothing and end up with nothing, there’s nothing lost.
list.author: Michael Dunlop

list.text: “Start today, not tomorrow. If anything, you should have started yesterday.
list.author: Emil Motycka

list.text: “Make it happen now, not tomorrow. Tomorrow is a loser’s excuse.
list.author: Andrew Fashion

list.text: “Every day I get up and look through the Forbes list of the richest people in America. If I’m not there, I go to work.
list.author: Robert Orben

list.text: “Entrepreneurship is living a few years of your life like most people won’t, so that you can spend the rest of your life like most people can’t.
list.author: Anonymous

list.text: “Yesterday’s home runs don’t win today’s games.
list.author: Babe Ruth

list.text: “You should always stay hungry. Stay hungry, so you can eat.
list.author: Syed Balkhi

list.text: “If you’re not living life on the edge, you’re taking up too much space.
list.author: Anonymous

list.text: “I wasn’t satisfied just to earn a good living. I was looking to make a statement.
list.author: Donald Trump

list.text: “Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
list.author: Thomas Edison

list.text: “You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills.
list.author: Jim Rohn

list.text: “Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
list.author: Mark Twain

list.text: “Not a single person whose name is worth remembering lived a life of ease.
list.author: Ryan P. Allis

list.text: “If you think that you are going to love something, give it a try. You’re going to kick yourself in the butt for the rest of your life if you don’t.
list.author: Joe Penna

list.text: “The best time to plant a tree is twenty years ago. The second best time is now.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “If you want one year of prosperity, grow grain. If you want ten years of prosperity, grow trees. If you want one hundred years of prosperity, grow people.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Vision without action is a daydream. Action without vision is a nightmare.
list.author: Japanese Proverb

list.text: “Sow a thought, reap an action; sow an action, reap a habit; sow a habit, reap a character; sow a character, reap a destiny.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “A bad workman blames his tools.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Defeat isn’t bitter if you don’t swallow it.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “The diamond cannot be polished without friction, nor the man perfected without trials.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “A jade stone is useless before it is processed; a man is good-for-nothing until he is educated.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “The loftiest towers rise from the ground.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Building a castle is difficult. Defending and maintaining it is harder still.
list.author: Asian Proverb

list.text: “A person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the man doing it.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “All cats love fish but fear to wet their paws.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Don’t stand by the water and long for fish; go home and weave a net.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Everyone should carefully observe which way his heart draws him, and then choose that way with all his strength.
list.author: Hasidic Proverb

list.text: “Failing to plan is planning to fail.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “If you pay peanuts, you get monkeys.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Make happy those who are near, and those who are far will come.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
list.author: Chinese Proverb

list.text: “Find a job you love and you’ll never work a day in your life.
list.author: Confucius

list.text: “The entrepreneur builds an enterprise; the technician builds a job.
list.author: Michael Gerber

list.text: “If you want to be inventive
list.author: you have to be willing to fail.”

list.text: “The challenge is not just to build a company that can endure; but to build one that is worthy of enduring.
list.author: Jim Collins

list.text: “Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can’t lose.
list.author: Bill Gates

list.text: “Don’t treat your customers like a bunch of purses and wallets.
list.author: Chris Brogan

list.text: “Nine out of ten businesses fail; so I came up with a foolproof plan
list.author: create ten businesses.”

list.text: “I’m not a businessman
list.author: I”m a business, man.”

list.text: “If plan ‘A’ fails
list.author: remember you have 25 letters left.”

list.text: “We make a living by what we get. But we make a life by what we give.
list.author: Winston Churchhill

list.text: “Believe that you will succeed
list.author: and you will.”

list.text: “Victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
list.author: Og Mandino

list.text: “As long as you’re going to be thinking anyway, think big.
list.author: Donald Trump

list.text: “Success is how high you bounce after you hit bottom
list.author: General George Patton

list.text: “Remembering you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
list.author: Steve Jobs

list.text: “It’s not about how to get started; its about how to get noticed.
list.author: Steve Case

list.text: “A ship in harbor is safe, but that’s not what ships are for.
list.author: John Shedd

list.text: “If I find 10,000 ways something won’t work, I haven’t failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is often a step forward.
list.author: Thomas Edison

list.text: “Business opportunities are like buses, there’s always another one coming.
list.author: Richard Branson

list.text: “If we don’t allow ourselves to make mistakes, we will never invest in things that are radical.
list.author: Jeff Clavier

list.text: “The critical ingredient is getting off your butt and doing something.
list.author: Nolan Bushnell

list.text: “Nothing will work unless you do.
list.author: Maya Angelou

list.text: “Try not to be a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.text: “You won’t get anything unless you have the vision to imagine it.
list.author: John Lennon

list.text: “A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
list.author: John C. Maxwell

list.text: “In the modern world of business, it is useless to be a creative, original thinker unless you can also sell what you create.
list.author: David Ogilvy

list.text: “Success is doing what you want, where you want, when you want, with whom you want as much as you want.
list.author: Tony Robbins

list.text: “If you don’t have a competitive advantage
list.author: don’t compete.”

list.text: “You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
list.author: Zig Ziglar

list.text: “If everything seems under control, you’re just not going fast enough.
list.author: Mario Andretti

list.text: “Don’t be trapped by dogma
list.author: which is living with the results of other people’s thinking.”

list.text: “Do or do not. There is no try.
list.author: Yoda

list.text: “Show me a person who never made a mistake, and I will show you a person who never did anything.
list.author: William Rosenberg, founder of Dunkin’ Donuts

list.text: “Ideas are commodity. Execution of them is not.
list.author: Michael Dell, CEO of Dell

list.text: “User experience is everything. It always has been, but it’s undervalued and underinvested in. If you don’t know user-centered design, study it. Hire people who know it. Obsess over it. Live and breathe it. Get your whole company on board.
list.author: Evan Williams, co-founder of Twitter

list.text: “A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
list.author: Winston Churchill, British Prime Minister

list.text: “The man who does not work for the love of work but only for money is likely to neither make money nor find much fun in life.
list.author: Charles M. Schwab, American steel magnate

list.text: “Be undeniably good. No marketing effort or social media buzzword can be a substitute for that.
list.author: Anthony Volodkin, founder of Hype Machine

list.text: “Ideas are easy. Implementation is hard.
list.author: Guy Kawasaki, founder of AllTop

list.text: “You can say anything to anyone, but how you say it will determine how they will react.
list.author: John Rampton, entrepreneur and investor

list.text: “Always deliver more than expected.
list.author: Larry Page, co-founder of Google

list.text: “Assume you have 90 seconds with a new user before they decide to use your app or delete it.
list.author: Tamara Steffens, Acompli

list.text: “Even if you don’t have the perfect idea to begin with, you can likely adapt.
list.author: Victoria Ransom, co-founder of Wildfire Interactive

list.text: “Make your team feel respected, empowered and genuinely excited about the company’s mission.
list.author: Tim Westergen, founder of Pandora

list.text: “Stay self-funded as long as possible.
list.author: Garrett Camp, co-founder of Stumbleupon

list.text: “In between goals is a thing called life, that has to be lived and enjoyed.
list.author: Sid Caesar, Entertainer

list.text: “Wonder what your customer really wants? Ask. Don’t tell.
list.author: Lisa Stone, co-founder of BlogHer

list.text: “When times are bad is when the real entrepreneurs emerge.
list.author: Robert Kiyosaki, from of Rich Dad Poor Dad

list.text: “What do you need to start a business? Three simple things: know your product better than anyone, know your customer, and have a burning desire to succeed.
list.author: Dave Thomas, founder of Wendy’s

list.text: “Get big quietly, so you don’t tip off potential competitors.
list.author: Chris Dixon, co-founder of Hunch

list.text: “Don’t worry about failure; you only have to be right once.
list.author: Drew Houston, founder of Dropbox

list.text: “Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life. Don’t be trapped by dogma
list.author: which is living with the results of other people’s thinking. Don’t let the noise of other’s opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become. Everything else is secondary.”

list.text: “Don’t be cocky. Don’t be flashy. There’s always someone better than you.
list.author: Tony Hsieh, Zappos.com CEO

list.text: “Don’t take too much advice. Most people who have a lot of advice to give — with a few exceptions — generalize whatever they did. Don’t over-analyze everything. I myself have been guilty of over-thinking problems. Just build things and find out if they work.
list.author: Ben Silbermann, co-founder of Pinterest

list.text: “Openly share and talk to people about your idea. Use their lack of interest or doubt to fuel your motivation to make it happen.
list.author: Todd Garland, founder of BuySellAds

list.text: “How you climb a mountain is more important than reaching the top.
list.author: Yvon Chouinard, founder of Patagonia

list.text: “Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
list.author: Booker T. Washington, Educator and from

list.text: “It’s fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
list.author: Bill Gates, co-founder of Microsoft

list.text: “It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you’ll do things differently.
list.author: Warren Buffett, Investor

list.text: “Statistics suggest that when customers complain, business owners and managers ought to get excited about it. The complaining customer represents a huge opportunity for more business.
list.author: Zig Ziglar, from and motivational speaker

list.text: “There is only one success- to be able to spend your life in your own way.
list.author: Christopher Morley, journalist

list.text: “Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
list.author: Jim Rohn, from and speaker

list.text: “When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
list.author: Henry Ford, founder of Ford Motor Company

list.text: “Rarely have I seen a situation where doing less than the other guy is a good strategy.
list.author: Jimmy Spithill, Australian yachtsman

list.text: “You miss 100 percent of the shots you don’t take.
list.author: Wayne Gretzky, NHL Hall of Famer

list.text: “The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
list.author: Chinese proverb

list.text: “The secret to successful hiring is this: look for the people who want to change the world.
list.author: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce

list.text: “Twenty years from now, you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do, so throw off the bowlines, sail away from safe harbor, catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore, Dream, Discover.
list.author: Mark Twain, from

list.text: “If you’ve got an idea, start today. There’s no better time than now to get going. That doesn’t mean quit your job and jump into your idea 100% author day one, but there’s always small progress that can be made to start the movement.
list.author: Kevin Systrom, co-founder of Instagram

list.text: “It’s almost always harder to raise capital than you thought it would be, and it always takes longer. So plan for that.
list.author: Richard Harroch, Venture Capitalist

list.text: “For all of the most important things, the timing always sucks. Waiting for a good time to quit your job? The stars will never align and the traffic lights of life will never all be green at the same time. The universe doesn’t conspire against you, but it doesn’t go out of its way to line up the pins either. Conditions are never perfect. “Someday is a disease that will take your dreams to the grave with you. Pro and con lists are just as bad. If it’s important to you and you want to do it “eventually, just do it and correct course along the way.
list.author: Timothy Ferriss, author of The 4-Hour Work Week

list.text: “I don’t have big ideas. I sometimes have small ideas, which seem to work out.
list.author: Matt Mullenweg, founder of Automattic

list.text: “Fail often so you can succeed sooner.
list.author: Tom Kelley, Ideo partner

list.text: “When you cease to dream you cease to live.
list.author: Malcolm Forbes, chairman and editor in chief of Forbes Magazine

list.text: “Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, the mind can achieve.
list.author: Dr. Napoleon Hill, author of Think and Grow Rich

list.text: “Running a start-up is like eating glass. You just start to like the taste of your own blood.
list.author: Sean Parker, co-founder of Napster

list.text: “My number one piece of advice is: you should learn how to program.
list.author: Mark Zuckerberg, founder of Facebook

list.text: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
list.author: Walt Disney, co-founder of the Walt Disney Company

list.text: “The pace of change for entrepreneurs is rapidly accelerating, and the cost and risk of launching a new business and getting off the ground is just amazing. The ability to gain user feedback really quickly and adapt to what your consumers want is totally different with the web as it is now. But finding a new market, helping people and taking that original idea and turning it into a business is really exciting right now.
list.author: Matt Mickiewicz, co-founder of 99 Designs

list.text: “Building and hanging on to an audience is the biggest role of social media.
list.author: Matthew Inman, The Oatmeal

list.text: “Every feature has some maintenance cost, and having fewer features lets us focus on the ones we care about and make sure they work very well.
list.author: David Karp, founder of Tumblr

list.text: “A poorly implemented feature hurts more than not having it at all.
list.author: Noah Everett, founder of Twitpic

list.text: “This defines entrepreneur and entrepreneurship
list.author: the entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.”― Peter F. Drucker, educator and author

list.text: “You don’t learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing and falling over.
list.author: Richard Branson, founder of Virgin Group

list.text: “The fastest way to change yourself is to hang out with people who are already the way you want to be.
list.author: Reid Hoffman, co-founder of Linkedin

list.text: “Risk more than others think is safe. Dream more than others think is practical.
list.author: Howard Schultz, CEO of Starbucks

list.text: “You shouldn’t focus on why you can’t do something, which is what most people do. You should focus on why perhaps you can, and be one of the exceptions.
list.author: Steve Case, co-founder of AOL

list.text: “The critical ingredient is getting off your butt and doing something. It’s as simple as that. A lot of people have ideas, but there are few who decide to do something about them now. Not tomorrow. Not next week. But today. The true entrepreneur is a doer not a dreamer.
list.author: Nolan Bushnell, founder of Atari

list.text: “If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
list.author: Napoleon Hill, author

list.text: “Success is not what you have, but who you are.
list.author: Bo Bennet, author and entreprenuer

list.text: “One of the huge mistakes people make is that they try to force an interest on themselves. You don’t choose your passions; your passions choose you.
list.author: Jeff Bezos, founder and CEO of Amazon.com

list.text: “Lots of companies don’t succeed over time. What do they fundamentally do wrong? They usually miss the future.
list.author: Larry Page, CEO of Google

list.text: “It takes humility to realize that we don’t know everything, not to rest on our laurels and know that we must keep learning and observing. If we don’t, we can be sure some startup will be there to take our place.
list.author: Cher Wang, CEO of HTC

list.text: “There’s an entrepreneur right now, scared to death, making excuses, saying, ‘It’s not the right time just yet.’ There’s no such thing as a good time. Get out of your garage and go take a chance, and start your business.
list.author: Kevin Plank, CEO of Under Armour

list.text: “Be really picky with your hiring, and hire the absolute best people you possibly can. People are the most important component of almost every business, and attracting the best talent possible is going to make a huge difference.
list.author: Peter Berg, founder of October Three

list.text: “Worry about being better; bigger will take care of itself. Think one customer at a time and take care of each one the best way you can.
list.author: Gary Comer, founder of Land’s End

list.text: “You have a viable business only if your product is either better or cheaper than the alternatives. If it’s not one or the other, you might make some money at first, but it’s not a sustainable business.
list.author: Jim Koch, founder of Boston Beer Co.

list.text: “Every time I took these bigger risks, the opportunity for a bigger payout was always there.
list.author: Casey Neistat, filmmaker

list.text: “If you can do something to get somebody excited — not everybody — but if you can be the best for somebody, then you can win.
list.author: Ron Shaich, founder and CEO of Panera Bread

list.text: “Would you like me to give you a formula for success? It’s quite simple, really: Double your rate of failure. You are thinking of failure as the enemy of success. But it isn’t at all. You can be discouraged by failure or you can learn author it, so go ahead and make mistakes. Make all you can. Because remember that’s where you will find success.
list.author: Thomas J. Watson, businessman

list.text: “People who succeed have momentum. The more they succeed, the more they want to succeed, and the more they find a way to succeed. Similarly, when someone is failing, the tendency is to get on a downward spiral that can even become a self-fulfilling prophecy.
list.author: Tony Robbins, motivational speaker

list.text: “The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
list.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

list.text: “The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
list.author: Bruce Lee, actor and martial arts instructor

list.text: “Fall seven times and stand up eight.
list.author: Japanese proverb

list.text: “The successful man is the one who finds out what is the matter with his business before his competitors do.
list.author: Roy L. Smith, animator and film director

list.text: “There’s no shortage of remarkable ideas, what’s missing is the will to execute them.
list.author: Seth Godin, author and speaker

list.text: “Keep on going, and the chances are that you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I never heard of anyone ever stumbling on something sitting down.
list.author: Charles F. Kettering, inventor

list.text: “A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
list.author: David Brinkley, newscaster

list.text: “Everyone is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will spend its whole life believing it is stupid.
list.author: Albert Einstein, Theoretical Physicist

list.text: “Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you’re not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
list.author: David Rockefeller, American banker

list.text: “It is never too late to be what you might have been.
list.author: George Eliot, journalist and novelist

list.text: “I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
list.author: Stephen Covey, author and businessman

list.text: “There is only one way to avoid criticism: Do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
list.author: Aristotle, Greek philosopher

list.text: “Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
list.author: Farrah Gray, investor and motivational speaker

list.text: “You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don’t try.
list.author: Beverly Sills, operatic soprano

list.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
list.author: null

list.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
list.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

list.text: Your only limit is the amount of willingness you possess.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
list.author: Sam Levenson

list.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
list.author: Roy T. Bennett

list.text: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
list.author: Albert Schweitzer

list.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
list.author: Theodore Roosevelt

list.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
list.author: Walt Disney

list.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
list.author: Theodore Roosevelt

list.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
list.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

list.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
list.author: Peter Drucker

list.text: Success is not the absence of failure; it's the persistence through failure.
list.author: Aisha Tyler

list.text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
list.author: Will Rogers

list.text: The true test of leadership is how well you function in a crisis.
list.author: Brian Tracy

list.text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
list.author: Zig Ziglar

list.text: The biggest challenge in life is being yourself…in a world trying to make you like everyone else.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Believe in yourself, take on your challenges, dig deep within yourself to conquer fears. Never let anyone bring you down. You got this.
list.author: Chantal Sutherland

list.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
list.author: Confucius

list.text: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
list.author: Maya Angelou

list.text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
list.author: William James

list.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
list.author: Steve Jobs

list.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
list.author: Wayne Gretzky

list.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
list.author: Epictetus

list.text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
list.author: Roy T. Bennett

list.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
list.author: Arthur Ashe

list.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
list.author: C.S. Lewis

list.text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.text: Believe in yourself, take on your challenges, dig deep within yourself to conquer fears. Never let anyone bring you down. You got this.
list.author: Chantal Sutherland

list.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
list.author: Jim Rohn

list.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
list.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

list.text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
list.author: Will Rogers

list.text: The biggest challenge in life is being yourself…in a world trying to make you like everyone else.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
list.author: Theodore Roosevelt

list.text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
list.author: Mahatma Gandhi

list.text: Chase the vision, not the money; the money will end up following you.
list.author: Tony Hsieh

list.text: It's not about perfect. It's about effort. And when you bring that effort every single day, that's where transformation happens. That's how change occurs.
list.author: Jillian Michaels

list.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
list.author: Peter Drucker

list.text: If you want to achieve greatness, stop asking for permission.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
list.author: Roy T. Bennett

list.text: Success is not the absence of failure; it's the persistence through failure.
list.author: Aisha Tyler

list.text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
list.author: Zig Ziglar

list.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
list.author: Christian D. Larson

list.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
list.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

list.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
list.author: Thomas Edison

list.text: “Self-care is how you take your power back.”

list.text: “The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.”

list.text: “Self-care is not a luxury, it’s a necessity.”

list.text: “Nourishing yourself in a way that helps you blossom in the direction you want to go is attainable, and you are worth the effort.”

list.text: “Almost everything will work if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.”

list.text: “You can’t pour from an empty cup. Take care of yourself first.”

list.text: “Love yourself enough to set boundaries. Your time and energy are precious. You get to choose how you use it. You teach people how to treat you by deciding what you will and won’t accept.”

list.text: “Self-compassion is simply giving the same kindness to ourselves that we would give to others.”

list.text: “Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.”

list.text: “Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what’s left of you.”

list.text: “Self-love is the source of all other loves.”

list.text: “Remember always that you not only have the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one.”

list.text: “The most important relationship is the one you have with yourself.”

list.text: Tujhse naraz nahi zindagi, hairan hu mai
list.author: Gulzar

list.text: Pal, do pal, ki hi kyun hai zindagi, iss pyar ko hai sadiyaan kaafi nahi
list.author: Javed Akhtar

list.text: Kuch khaas hai, kuch paas hai, kuch ajnabi ehsaas hai
list.author: Vishal Dadlani

list.text: Kabhi kabhi mere dil mein khayal aata hai
list.author: Sahir Ludhianvi

list.text: Tere bina zindagi se koi shikwa to nahi, tere bina zindagi bhi lekin zindagi to nahi
list.author: Gulzar

list.text: Jo haal dil ka idhar ho raha hai, woh samaa ka aalam kuchh bhi nahi hai
list.author: Javed Akhtar

list.text: Jeene ke ishaare mil gaye, hum to sare kho gaye
list.author: Amitabh Bhattacharya

list.text: Aisa koi zindagi mein aaye, jo zindagi ko zindagi banaye
list.author: Irshad Kamil

list.text: Tum hi ho, ab tum hi ho, zindagi ab tum hi ho
list.author: Mithoon

list.text: Kahin toh hogi woh, duniya jahaan tu mere saath hai
list.author: Javed Akhtar

list.text: Patakha guddi, aavey patakha kudi
list.author: Irshad Kamil

list.text: Abhi mujh mein kahin, baaki thodi si hai zindagi
list.author: Turaz

list.text: Iktara, iktara, wake up sid
list.author: Amitabh Bhattacharya

list.text: Lag jaa gale, ki phir ye haseen raat ho na ho
list.author: Raja Mehdi Ali Khan

list.text: Tere jaisa yaar kahan, kahan aisa yaaraana, yaad karegi duniya, tera mera afsaana
list.author: Anand Bakshi

list.text: Aadha ishq, aadha hai, aadha hojayega
list.author: Amitabh Bhattacharya

list.text: Tum se hi din hota hai, surmaiye shaam aati hai
list.author: Irshad Kamil

list.text: Kal ho na ho, har ghadi badal rahi hai roop zindagi

list.text: Jiski aankhon mein meri hi nami ho, ussi chandni raat mein, chand bhi chhup jaye

list.author: Amitabh Bhattacharya

list.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
list.author: Albert Schweitzer

list.text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
list.author: Roy T. Bennett

list.text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
list.author: Bo Bennet

list.text: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
list.author: Booker T. Washington

list.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
list.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

list.text: Success is not always about greatness. It’s about consistency. Consistent hard work leads to success. Greatness will come.
list.author: Dwayne Johnson

list.text: Success is not the absence of failure; it's the persistence through failure.
list.author: Aisha Tyler

list.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.text: Success is a journey, not a destination.
list.author: Ben Sweetland

list.text: Success is not just what you accomplish in your life, it's about what you inspire others to do.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Success is not how far you have come, but how far you can go.
list.author: Unknown

list.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
list.author: Robert Collier

list.text: Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
list.author: Bruce Lee

list.text: Success is not a destination, but the road that you're on. Being successful means that you're working hard and walking your walk every day.
list.author: Marlon Wayans

list.text: Success is not about being a genius or getting lucky. It's about having a strong work ethic, enjoying what you do, and learning from your mistakes.
list.author: Mychal Wynn

list.text: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
list.author: Vince Lombardi

list.text: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
list.author: Maya Angelou

list.text: The successful man is the one who finds out what is the matter with his business before his competitors do.
list.author: Roy L. Smith

list.text: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
list.author: Conrad Hilton

list.text: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
list.author: Orison Swett Marden

list.text: Success is not something that falls into your lap. It's something that you work for and strive for every day.
list.author: Dwayne Johnson

list.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
list.author: John Wooden

list.text: Success is about creating benefit for all and enjoying the process. If you focus on this and adopt this definition, success is yours.
list.author: Kelly Kim

list.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
list.author: Buddha

list.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
list.author: Bruce Lee

list.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
list.author: Albert Schweitzer

list.text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
list.author: Winston Churchill

list.text: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
list.author: George S. Patton

list.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
list.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

list.text: You have to be able to tolerate what you don’t necessarily like so you can be free.
list.author: Larry Flynt

list.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

list.text: All travel has its advantages. If the passenger visits better countries, he may learn to improve his own. And if fortune carries him to worse, he may learn to enjoy it.

list.text: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.

list.text: I travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape me.

list.text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

list.text: Work hard in silence, let success make the noise.
list.author: null

list.text: Do what you love, and you will never work a day in your life.
list.author: null

list.text: Hard work beats talent when talent doesn't work hard.
list.author: Tim Notke

list.text: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
list.author: Vince Lombardi

list.text: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
list.author: Colin Powell

list.text: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
list.author: George Allen, Sr.

list.text: I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
list.author: Thomas Jefferson

list.text: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice, and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
list.author: Pele

list.text: A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination, and hard work.
list.author: Colin Powell

list.text: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stressed; working hard for something we love is called passion.
list.author: Simon Sinek

list.text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
list.author: Confucius

list.text: The only way to achieve success is to have a clear goal, work hard towards it, and stay focused.
list.author: null

list.text: Success is not easy, but it is possible if you are willing to work hard, learn from your mistakes, and never give up.
list.author: null

list.text: Hard work may not always bring success, but it will always bring respect.
list.author: null

list.text: Success is not about luck; it's about hard work, determination, and persistence.
list.author: null

list.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.

list.text: Success in life comes when you simply refuse to give up, with goals so strong that obstacles, failure, and loss only act as motivation.
list.author: null

list.text: It's not about having the skill to do something. It's about having the will, desire, and commitment to be your best.

list.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.

list.text: Work hard, stay focused, and keep moving forward. Success will come.
list.author: null

list.text: Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
list.author: null

list.text: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
